quotes.quote: Hygiene is going to be a key consumer question post-COVID. Our sanitized stay offerings and commitment towards ensuring minimal contact-based check-in is an important step.
quotes.author: Ritesh Agarwal

quotes.quote: Practice good personal hygiene. Wash your hands before you eat. Be aware of good clean water and food sources.
quotes.author: James Wright

quotes.quote: I must go to the washroom. I've shaken a lot of hands.
quotes.author: Yann Martel

quotes.quote: Time hygiene is about finding more time for ourselves: to think, to do what we like.
quotes.author: Jens Martin Skibsted

quotes.quote: We spend more and more time at our desks, but we haven't learned to bring the hygiene habits we have at home to the office.
quotes.author: Charles Gerba

quotes.quote: Being sleep-deprived not only hurts you at work, it hurts your health. You need to value yourself enough to have good sleep hygiene.
quotes.author: Marty Nemko

quotes.quote: If you go long enough without a bath, even the fleas will leave you alone.
quotes.author: Ernie Pyle

quotes.quote: Values are related to our emotions, just as we practice physical hygiene to preserve our physical health, we need to observe emotional hygiene to preserve a healthy mind and attitudes.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: Come, Hygiene, goddess of the growing boy, / I here salute thee in Sanatogen! / Anaemic girls need Virol, but for me / Be Scott's Emulsion, rusks, and Mellin's Food, / Cod-liver oil and malt, and for my neck Wright's Coal Tar Soap, Euthymol for my teeth. / Come friends of Hygiene, Electricity / And those young twins, Free Thought and clean Fresh Air: / Attend the long express from Waterloo / That takes us down to Cornwall.
quotes.author: John Betjeman

quotes.quote: There are those of us who do not choose to live in some huge, wholesome happycamper Disneyland hygiene and pumped-up enthusiasm.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.quote: 2.5 billion people (roughly two-fifths of the world's population) do not have adequate sanitation according to the United Nations. 6,000 children each day die from unsafe water and sanitation: that is the equivalent of 20 jumbo jets filled with children crashing every day.
quotes.author: Brenda Knight

quotes.quote: Cleanliness of body was ever esteemed to proceed from a due reverence to God.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Certainly, this is a duty—not a sin.—Cleanliness is, indeed, next to Godliness.
quotes.author: John Wesley

quotes.quote: Let thy mind's sweetness have its operation upon thy body, thy clothes, and thy habitation.
quotes.author: George Herbert

quotes.quote: The consciousness of clean linen is, in, and of itself, a source of moral strength, second only to that of a clean conscience. A well-ironed collar or a fresh glove has carried many a man through an emergency in which a wrinkle or a rip would have defeated him.
quotes.author: E. S. Phelps

quotes.quote: Even from the body's purity the mind receives a secret sympathetic aid.
quotes.author: Thomson

quotes.quote: So great is the effect of cleanliness upon man, that it extends even to his moral character. Virtue never dwelt long with filth; nor do I believe there ever was a person scrupulously attentive to cleanliness who was a consummate villain.
quotes.author: Rumford

quotes.quote: Beauty commonly produces love, but cleanliness preserves it. Age itself is not unamiable while it is preserved clean and unsullied—like a piece of metal constantly kept smooth and bright, which we look on with more pleasure than on a new vessel cankered with rust.
quotes.author: Addison

quotes.quote: Cleanliness may be recommended as a mark of politeness, as it produces affection, and as it bears analogy to purity of mind. As it renders us agreeable to others, so it makes us easy to ourselves. It is an excellent preservative of health; and several vices, destructive both to body and mind, are inconsistent with the habit of it.
quotes.author: Addison

quotes.quote: Better keep yourself clean and bright; you are the window through which you must see the world.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: You come before me this morning with clean hands and clean collars. I want you to have clean tongues, clean manners, clean morals and clean characters.
quotes.author: John E. Burns

quotes.quote: God looks at the clean hands, not the full ones.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: Cleanliness is part of glory.
quotes.author: Irish Proverb

quotes.quote: Hygiene and Cleanliness are part of our religion; it will be really disheartening for a Muslim to be filthy. I must remind this to us; dirtiness is averse to our religion.
quotes.author: Sheikh Zakzaky

quotes.quote: When you train the teachers to keep clean bodies, teeth, tongue, hair, feet, socks, and armpits, then you have a well-groomed, alert and astute teacher.
quotes.author: Janet Museveni

quotes.quote: Wellness is multi-faceted. It’s about physical, emotional and spiritual health.
quotes.author: Skip Prichard

quotes.quote: To keep the body in good health is a duty ... otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.quote: Good personal hygiene, won't stab me in my sleep.
quotes.author: Leo Spitz

quotes.quote: The gap between what publicity actually offers and the future it promises, corresponds with the gap between what the spectator-buyer feels himself to be and what he would like to be.
quotes.author: John Berger

quotes.quote: If you hype something and it succeeds, you're a genius - it wasn't a hype. If you hype it and it fails, then it was just a hype.
quotes.author: Neil Bogart

quotes.quote: Do you realize the power you have, to build and to destroy; to promote success or failure; to bring life or death to a cause or talent; to give a platform or take it away?
quotes.author: Archibald Marwizi

quotes.quote: People will go for anything they don't understand if it's got enough hype.
quotes.author: Miles Davis

quotes.quote: It is now certain that the public does know. It is not so certain that the public does care.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: Put the fire out? Hell no. What we need to do is stoke it.
quotes.author: Jess Walter

quotes.quote: The fact that hype exists doesn't prove that something is not important.
quotes.author: Vilayanur S. Ramachandran

quotes.quote: The easiest way to not believe your own hype is to not know what people are saying about you.
quotes.author: Debby Ryan

quotes.quote: The hype cheapens the hyped, as right things are then made wrong by exaggeration.
quotes.author: Criss Jami

quotes.quote: You have to find what makes you stable in the storm. Then, no matter what's happening around you, no matter what the hype or publicity, you can still manage to make leaps in your work as an artist.
quotes.author: Jimmy Smiths

quotes.quote: The hype man's job is to get everybody out of their seats and on the dance floor to have a good time.
quotes.author: Flavor Flav

quotes.quote: Many a small thing has been made large by the right kind of advertising.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Society drives people crazy with lust and calls it advertising.
quotes.author: John Lahr

quotes.quote: A guided meditation is like sending your subconscious an email newsletter while hypnosis is like sending your subconscious a handwritten letter.
quotes.author: Juliet C Obodo

quotes.quote: You use hypnosis not as a cure but as a means of establishing a favorable climate in which to learn.
quotes.author: Milton Erickson

quotes.quote: The collective dream is the hypnosis of social conditioning. Only sages, psychotics & geniuses manage to break free.
quotes.author: Deepak Chopra.

quotes.quote: Hypnosis is about shutting down the conscious mind and re-igniting the unconscious and the imagination, so while I give instructions to them under hypnosis, the contestants might interpret those instructions in all kinds of ways.
quotes.author: Keith Barry

quotes.quote: Hypnosis is a normal and natural way of knowing your inner self and augmenting it with virtues like self-belief.
quotes.author: Dr. Prem Jagyasi

quotes.quote: An idea accepted as true from any source can be every bit as powerful as hypnosis.
quotes.author: Maxwell Maltz

quotes.quote: Hypnosis is a powerful force and in my opinion should be employed only by the best-trained and most ethical professionals for very important reasons.
quotes.author: Joe J. Christensen

quotes.quote: What gets in our way is history and culture and religion and economic conditions. It is part of the hypnosis of our social conditioning.
quotes.author: Deepak Chopra

quotes.quote: Hypnosis I believe is real. The only problem I guess I have is that, you know, if God or somebody who passed on in my life wanted to talk to me, why wouldn't they come directly to me?
quotes.author: Sean Hannity

quotes.quote: Emma says her illness was a kind of self-hypnosis which obliterated the outside world, a way of escaping life and reducing its proportions to what she could manage.
quotes.author: Carol Lee

quotes.quote: You have to realise that hypnosis doesn't exist: it just works on people's natural suggestibility, their expectations and capacity to unconsciously role play. You can't make someone do anything they don't want to do.
quotes.author: Derren Brown

quotes.quote: A democratic civilization will save itself only if it makes the language of the image into a stimulus for critical reflection — not an invitation for hypnosis.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.quote: Hypnosis is an excellent tool to help a patient remember long-forgotten incidents.
quotes.author: Brian L. Weiss

quotes.quote: Part of being an actor is almost self-hypnosis during those brief moments when the cameras are rolling. You want to actually believe you're Chris Gardner or Muhammad Ali.
quotes.author: Will Smith

quotes.quote: The purpose of hypnosis as a therapeutic technique is to help you understand and gain more control over your behavior, emotions or physical well-being.
quotes.author: The Mayo Clinic

quotes.quote: Hypnosis is not sleep,... it has no special relationship to sleep, and the whole concept of sleep when applied to hypnosis obscures the situation.
quotes.author: Clark L. Hull

quotes.quote: Hypnosis is the most effective way of giving up smoking, according to the largest ever scientific comparison of ways of breaking the habit.
quotes.author: New Scientist

quotes.quote: Writing is like being in a dream state or under self-directed hypnosis. It induces a state of recall that - while not perfect - is pretty spooky.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.quote: It's obvious that the happy man feels contented only because the unhappy ones bear their burden without saying a word: if it weren't for their silence, happiness would be quite impossible. It's a kind of mass hypnosis.
quotes.author: Anton Chekov

quotes.quote: I'd feel a whole lot better knowing a person was falling in love with me because of me and not because of hypnosis or snug purple gowns.
quotes.author: Cat Winters

quotes.quote: As far as hypnosis is concerned, I had a very serious problem when I was in my twenties. I encountered a man who later became the president of the American Society of Medical Hypnosis. He couldn't hypnotize me.
quotes.author: Theodore Sturgeon

quotes.quote: Hypnosis is just suggestibility; you see it in certain people.
quotes.author: Derren Brown

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy is a tribute which vice pays to virtue.
quotes.author: François de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: The hypocrite’s crime is that he bears false witness against himself. What makes it so plausible to assume that hypocrisy is the vice of vices is that integrity can indeed exist under the cover of all other vices except this one. Only crime and the criminal, it is true, confront us with the perplexity of radical evil; but only the hypocrite is really rotten to the core.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.quote: Polite, adj. Skilled in the art and practice of dissimulation.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: Most people sell their souls, and live with a good conscience on the proceeds.
quotes.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.quote: In England the only homage which they pay to Virtue — is hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Lord Byron

quotes.quote: He combines the manners of a Marquis with the morals of a Methodist.
quotes.author: W.S. Gilbert

quotes.quote: If I were two-faced would I be wearing this one?
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: In 1969 I published a small book on Humility. It was a pioneering work which has not, to my knowledge, been superseded.
quotes.author: Lord Longford

quotes.quote: I hope you have not been leading a double life, pretending to be wicked and being really good all the time. That would be hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: I call it not humility, so long as we think there is any good remaining in us. Those who have joined together two things, to think humbly of ourselves before God and yet hold our own righteousness in some estimation, have . . . a pernicious hypocrisy.
quotes.author: John Calvin

quotes.quote: There is nothing which God more abominates than when men endeavor to cloak themselves by submitting signs and external appearance for integrity of heart.
quotes.author: John Calvin

quotes.quote: The human heart has so many crannies where vanity hides, so many holes where falsehood lurks, is so decked out with deceiving hypocrisy, that it often dupes itself.
quotes.author: John Calvin

quotes.quote: It's gotten to the point that our ability to manufacture fraud now exceeds our ability to detect it.
quotes.author: Andrew Niccol

quotes.quote: If you don't live it, it won’t come out of your horn.
quotes.author: Charlie Parker

quotes.quote: Along with much bad thinking . . . goes split living.
quotes.author: J.I. Packer

quotes.quote: Many a man who tries to talk as if he were standing on a mountain shows by what he says that he is up to his eyes in the mud.
quotes.author: Billy Sunday

quotes.quote: Conventionality is not morality. Self- righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last. To pluck the mask from the face of the Pharisee, is not to lift an impious hand to the Crown of Thorns.
quotes.author: Charlotte Bronte

quotes.quote: Keep up appearances; there lies the test; / The world will give thee credit for the rest. / Outward be fair, however foul within; / Sin if thou wilt, but then in secret sin.
quotes.author: Charles Churchill

quotes.quote: In the mouths of many men soft words are like roses that soldiers put into the muzzles of their muskets on holidays.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy is the most difficult and nerve-racking vice that any man can pursue; it needs an unceasing vigilance and a rare detachment of spirit. It cannot, like adultery or gluttony, be practised at spare moments; it is a whole-time job.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: I want that glib and oily art / To speak and purpose not.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I sit on a man’s back, choking him and making him carry me, and yet assure myself and others that I am very sorry for him and wish to ease his lot by all possible means—except by getting off his back.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: Democracies cannot dispense with hypocrisy any more than dictatorships can with cynicism.
quotes.author: Georges Bernanos

quotes.quote: Good now, play one scene / Of excellent dissembling, and let it look / Like perfect honor.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: One, by his own confession to me, that can put on two several faces, anti look his enemies in the face with as much love as his friends. But, good God! what an age is this, and what a world is this! that a man cannot live without playing the knave and dissimulation.
quotes.author: Samuel Pepys

quotes.quote: Without some dissimulation no business can he carried on at all.
quotes.author: Earl of Philip Dormer Stanhope Chesterfield

quotes.quote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: If it were not for the intellectual snobs who pay-in solid cash — the tribute which philistinism owes to culture, the arts would perish with their starving practitioners. Let us thank heaven for hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: It is very noble hypocrisy not to talk of one's self.
quotes.author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quotes.quote: There is a false modesty, which is vanity; a false glory, which is levity; a false grandeur. which is meanness; a false virtue, which is hypocrisy; and a false wisdom, which is prudery.
quotes.author: Jean De La Bruyere

quotes.quote: As hypocrisy is said to be the highest compliment to virtue, the art of lying is the strongest acknowledgment of the force of truth.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: The best brought-up children are those who have seen their parents as they are. Hypocrisy is not the parents’ first duty.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: There is a certain satisfaction in coming down to the lowest ground of politics, for then we get rid of cant and hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: She heard the snuffle of hypocrisy in her prayer. She had to cease to pray.
quotes.author: George Meredith

quotes.quote: Sincerity is the prime requisite in every approach to the God who . . . hates all hypocrisy, falsehood, and deceit.
quotes.author: Geoffrey B. Wilson

quotes.quote: Of all the cants which are canted in this canting world, tho‘ the cant of hypocrites may be the worst, the cant of criticism is the most tormenting.
quotes.author: Laurence Sterne

quotes.quote: What matters in Politics is what men actually do - sincerity is no excuse for acting unpolitically. and insincerity may be channelled by politics into good results.
quotes.author: Bernard Crick

quotes.quote: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
quotes.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.quote: But everybody agrees, somewhere in his heart, that there ought to be some connection between what you believe and how you behave, what you advocate for others and how you live yourself.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.quote: You don’t say ‘they all do it’ unless you know you’ve been doing it too.
quotes.author: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.quote: Humans are very seldom either totally sincere or totally hypocritical. Their moods change, their motives are mixed, and they arc often themselves quite mistaken as to what their motives are.
quotes.author: C.S. Lewis

quotes.quote: Let the world know you as you are, not as you think you should be, because sooner or later, if you are posing, you will forget the pose, and then where are you?
quotes.author: Fanny Brice

quotes.quote: Woe to you. scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs, which outwardly appear beautiful, but within they are full of dead men's bones and all uncleanness.
quotes.author: The Bible (Matthew 23:27)

quotes.quote: A criminal is twice a criminal when he adds hypocrisy to his crime.
quotes.author: Marie Corelli

quotes.quote: Even man alone is sincere. At the entrance of a second person, hypocrisy begins.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: No man, for any considerable period, can wear one face to himself and another to the multitude, without finally getting bewildered as to which may be the true.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.quote: For neither man nor angel can discern / Hypocrisy, the only evil that walks / Invisible, except to God alone.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.quote: In our interactions with people, a benevolent hypocrisy is frequently required — acting as though we do not see through the motives of their actions.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy in anything whatever may deceive the cleverest and most penetrating man, but the least wide-awake of children recognizes it, and is revolted by it, however ingeniously it may be disguised.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: A humanitarian is always a hypocrite.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: The first man was a hypocrite and a coward, qualities which have not yet failed in his line; it is the foundation upon which all civilizations have been built.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: If any teacher tries to persuade you that hypocrisy is not a part of your blood and bone and flesh, and can therefore be trained out of you by determined and watchful and ceaseless and diligent application to the job, do not you heed him; ask him to cure himself first, then call again.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: You say hypocrisy... absolutely! You're darn tooting! Hypocrisy! It's the latest fad. It's what the cool kids are into now, right? Let's not kid ourselves. We've gone from liberte egalite fraternite, to vanite letharge hypocrise. But in the words of Lord Byron, 'Let us have wine, women, mirth, and the laughter / Sermons and soda water the day after.'
quotes.author: Dean Van Puddy

quotes.quote: The human qualities can be expressed in one word: hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Joe

quotes.quote: Ooh, hypocrisy, Franklin. Civilization's greatest virtue.
quotes.author: Michael De Santa

quotes.quote: I studied at Oxford and Harvard. Majored in Western hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Colonel Moon

quotes.quote: You can... Love the church for their good works, or you can hate the church for their... Hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Robert Goren

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy is a boil. Lancing a boil is never pleasant. Although they could have been more careful with the blade.
quotes.author: High Sparrow

quotes.quote: Oh, Thomas. I see now what it takes for a man to make his way in this world. He must make a practice of hypocrisy.
quotes.author: John Lambert

quotes.quote: Do you think I'm a hypocrite? Well, you should. I wouldn't disagree with you. The road to power is paved with hypocrisy. And casualties. Never regret.
quotes.author: Francis Underwood

quotes.quote: Let's be philosophical. People have lived like hypocrites since the dawn of time. That's what you call 'civilisation.'
quotes.author: François Vasseur

quotes.quote: Well, you can't really admit to being a hypocrite because well, then you're not a hypocrite.
quotes.author: Gordo

quotes.quote: Rather a scoundrel than a hypocrite.
quotes.author: Jack Vincent

quotes.quote: You are thieves, killers, adulterers, blasphemers and liars six days a week! And on the seventh day you are hypocrites.
quotes.author: Florence

quotes.quote: The things I hate most, are the things that resemble my own faults. I hate bad manners. I hate people that don't give common courtesy. Hypocrites and cowards. That's all we are.
quotes.author: Richie

quotes.quote: Someone said / Give peace a chance / And, that's all that we're saying / While we're sitting / On the fence / Pretending, / Our hearts are in the right place / But, your face / Shows a trace of // Hypocrisy, / Don't tread on me, / Now you can see
quotes.author: Gary F. Cherone; Jimi Hendrix; Nuno Bettencourt

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy and feign'd pretence / To cover foul Dissigns / Shall blusshing fly as far from thence / As to the deepest Mines
quotes.author: Anne Kingsmill Finch

quotes.quote: In vain with whip and knotted cord / The hirelings of hypocrisy / Would make us comely for the Lord: / Think ye God works through such as ye — / Paid Puritan, plump Pharisee, / And lobbyist fingering his fat bill, / Reeking of rum and bribery: / God needs not you to work His will.
quotes.author: Richard Le Gallienne

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy, formality in prayer, / And the dull service of the lip were there.
quotes.author: William Cowper

quotes.quote: Nothing but truth before his throne / With honor can appear; / The painted hypocrites are known / Through the disguise they wear.
quotes.author: Isaac Watts

quotes.quote: The hypocrite is like unto this frog, / As like as is the puppy to the dog. / He is of nature cold, his mouth is wide / To prate, and at true goodness to deride. / He mounts his head as if he was above / The world, when yet 'tis that which has his love. / And though he seeks in churches for to croak, / He neither loveth Jesus nor his yoke.
quotes.author: John Bunyan

quotes.quote: Too oft is a smile / But the hypocrite's wile, / To mask detestation, or fear; / Give me the soft sigh, / Whilst the soultelling eye / Is dimm'd, for a time, with a Tear:
quotes.author: George Gordon Lord Byron

quotes.quote: Yea, every canting hypocrite since early Eocene, / In skin and silk and suit of mail and broadcloth stood serene, / Full sure his plight would be set right when the 'mistake' was seen.
quotes.author: Clarence Michael James Stanislaus Dennis

quotes.quote: Who deem his house a useless place, / Faith, want of common sense; / And ardour in the Christian race, / A hypocrite's pretence?
quotes.author: William Cowper

quotes.quote: Some poet chap had labelled man the noblest work of God: / I see myself a charlatan, a humbug and a fraud. / Yea, 'spite of show and shallow wit, an sentimental drool, / I know myself a hypocrite, a coward and a fool.
quotes.author: Robert William Service

quotes.quote: One keeps the heart-bred villain full in sight, / The other cants and acts the hypocrite, / Smoothing the deed where law sharks set their gin / Like a coy dog to draw misfortune in.
quotes.author: John Clare

quotes.quote: Smile, hypocrite, smile; it is no such hard labor, / While each stealthy hand stabs the heart of his neighbor — / Faugh! Fear not: we've no hearts in Vanity-fair.
quotes.author: Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

quotes.quote: If not good, why then evil, / If not good god, good devil. / Goodness! you hypocrite, come out of that, / Live your life, do your work, then take your hat.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Still must our ears without redress submit / To hear you play the solemn hypocrite / Walking in spirit some high moral level, / Raising at once his eye-balls and the devil?
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: But chicks from rotten eggs do not proceed, / Nor is a hypocrite a saint indeed. / The rotten egg, though underneath the hen, / If crack'd, stinks, and is loathsome unto men. / Nor doth her warmth make what is rotten sound; / What's rotten, rotten will at last be found. / The hypocrite, sin has him in possession, / He is a rotten egg under profession.
quotes.author: John Bunyan

quotes.quote: There is no mask but he will wear, / He invented oaths to swear, / He paints, he carves, he chants, he prays, / And holds all stars in his embrace, / Godlike, — but 'tis for his fine pelf, / The social quintessence of self.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: All are not saints, who go to church.
quotes.author: Italian (on hypocrisy)

quotes.quote: An open foe may prove a curse but a pretended friend is worse.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Be true to yourself.
quotes.author: unknown

quotes.quote: Beware of the person with two faces.
quotes.author: Dutch (on hypocrisy)

quotes.quote: False friends leave you in times of trouble.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.quote: If you would rise in the world, veil ambition with the forms of humanity.
quotes.author: Chinese (on hypocrisy)

quotes.quote: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: It is often easier to fight for your principles than to live up to them.
quotes.author: Adlai Stevenson

quotes.quote: Many have quarreled about religion that never practised it.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Many meet the gods but few salute them.
quotes.author: Latin (on courtesy and respect)

quotes.quote: Rudeness is a weak man's imitation of strength.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: The mouth prays to Buddha but the heart is full of evil.
quotes.author: Vietnamese (on hypocrisy)

quotes.quote: A man is a hypocrite only when he affects to take a delight in what he does not feel, not because he takes a perverse delight in opposite things.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: If Satan ever laughs, it must be at hypocrites; they are the greatest dupes he has; they serve him better than any others, and receive no wages.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: We ought to see far enough into a hypocrite to see even his sincerity.
quotes.author: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: A hypocrite is in himself both the archer and the mark, in all actions shooting at his own praise or profit.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: When you see a man with a great deal of religion displayed in his shop window, you may depend upon it he keeps a very small stock of it within.
quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.quote: Better to be known as a sinner than a hypocrite.
quotes.author: Proverb

quotes.quote: The only vice which cannot be forgiven is hypocrisy. The repentance of a hypocrite is itself hypocrisy.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: A hypocrite despises those whom he deceives, but has no respect for himself. He would make a dupe of himself too, if he could.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: A hypocrite is more dangerous than a dishonest man. A dishonest man deceives and cheats, and a hypocrite betrays and swindles.
quotes.author: Dr T.P.Chia

quotes.quote: A hypocrite is the kind of politician who would cut down a redwood tree, then mount the stump and make a speech for conservation.
quotes.author: Adlai E. Stevenson Ii

quotes.quote: We are all hypocrites. We cannot see ourselves or judge ourselves the way we see and judge others.
quotes.author: Jos_ Emilio Pacheco

quotes.quote: Hypocrite: the man who murdered both his parents... pleaded for mercy on the grounds that he was an orphan.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: The hypocrite who always plays one and the same part ceases at last to be a hypocrite.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul.
quotes.author: Bible

quotes.quote: Great hypocrite are the real atheists.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Hypocrites do the devil's drudgery in Christ's livery.
quotes.author: Matthew Henry

quotes.quote: Hypocrite - mouth one way, belly 'nother way.
quotes.author: Australian Aboriginal Proverb

quotes.quote: We are not hypocrites in our sleep.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: No man is a hypocrite in his pleasures.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: Whoever is a hypocrite in his religion mocks God, presenting to Him the outside and reserving the inward for his enemy.
quotes.author: Jeremy Taylor

quotes.quote: A hypocrite is a person who - but who isn't?
quotes.author: Don Marquis

quotes.quote: All humans are hypocrites; the biggest hypocrite of all is the one who claims to detest hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Peter Wastholm

quotes.quote: The hypocrite's crime is that he bears false witness against himself. What makes it so plausible to assume that hypocrisy is the vice of vices is that integrity can indeed exist under the cover of all other vices except this one. Only crime and the criminal, it is true, confront us with the perplexity of radical evil; but only the hypocrite is really rotten to the core.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.quote: The true hypocrite is the one who ceases to perceive his deception, the one who lies with sincerity.
quotes.author: Andr_ Gide

quotes.quote: Hypocrites get offended by the truth.
quotes.author: Jess C. Scott

quotes.quote: There has never been a truly selfless rebel, just hypocrites conscious hypocrites or unconscious hypocrites, it's all the same.
quotes.author: Frank Herbert

quotes.quote: Hypocrites in the Church? Yes, and in the lodge and at the home. Don't hunt through the Church for a hypocrite. Go home and look in the mirror. Hypocrites? Yes. See that you make the number one less.
quotes.author: Billy Sunday

quotes.quote: Everybody is a hypocrite. You can't live on this planet without being a hypocrite.
quotes.author: Paul Watson

quotes.quote: The difference between a saint and a hypocrite is that one lies for his religion, the other by it.
quotes.author: Minna Antrim

quotes.quote: Hypocrites kick with their hind feet while licking with their tongues.
quotes.author: Russian Proverb

quotes.quote: The heart of the hypocrite is hid in his breast he masketh his words in the semblance of truth, while the business of his life is only to deceive
quotes.author: Akhenaton

quotes.quote: The hypocrite looks for faults; the believer looks for excuses.
quotes.author: Al-Ghazali

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy: prejudice with a halo.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: The world is full of fools and faint hearts; and yet everyone has courage enough to bear the misfortunes, and wisdom enough to manage the affairs, of his neighbor.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Sincerity makes the very least person to be of more value than the most talented hypocrite.
quotes.author: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.quote: No power can be maintained when it is only represented by hypocrites.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Only crime and the criminal, it is true, confront us with the perplexity of radical evil; but only the hypocrite is really rotten to the core.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.quote: Those who make use of devotion as a means and end generally are hypocrites.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Hypocrisy in anything whatever may deceive the cleverest and most penetrating man, but the least wide-awake of children recognizes it, and is revolted by it, however ingeniously it may be disguised.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: Corruption and hypocrisy ought not to be inevitable products of democracy, as they undoubtedly are today.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Hypocrites are those who apply to others the standards that they refuse to accept for themselves.
quotes.author: Noam Chomsky

quotes.quote: There are many who are hypocrites although they think they are not, and there are many who are afraid of being hypocrites although they certainly are not. Which is the one and which is the other God knows, and none but He.
quotes.author: Walter Hilton

quotes.quote: He who would do good to another must do it in minute particulars.
quotes.author: William Blake

quotes.quote: They are the only honest hypocrites, their life is a voluntary dream, a studied madness.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: In any nation, the hypocrites do not become apparent except during times of fitnah (severe tests and hardships).
quotes.author: Yasmin Mogahed

quotes.quote: We are all sinners. But may the Lord not let us be hypocrites. Hypocrites don’t know the meaning of forgiveness, joy and the love of God.
quotes.author: Pope Francis

quotes.quote: Every man alone is sincere. At the entrance of a second person, hypocrisy begins
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Often those that criticise others reveal what he himself lacks.
quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.quote: He does not believe that does not live according to his belief.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: Stand up to hypocrisy. If you don't, the hypocrites will teach. Stand up to ignorance, because if you don't, the ignorant will run free to spread ignorance like a disease. Stand up for Truth! If you don't, there is no Truth to your existence. If you don't stand up for all that is right, then understand that you are part of the reason that there is so much wrong in the world.
quotes.author: Suzy Kassem

quotes.quote: The only thing worse than a liar is a liar that's also a hypocrite!
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.quote: We ought to see far enough into a hypocrite to see even his sincerity.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: I have found it easier to identify with the characters who verge upon hysteria, who were frightened of life, who were desperate to reach out to another person. But these seemingly fragile people are the strong people really.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.quote: Whatever hysteria exists is inflamed by mystery, suspicion and secrecy. Hard and exact facts will cool it.
quotes.author: Elia Kazan

quotes.quote: Hysteria is impossible without an audience. Panicking by yourself is the same as laughing alone in an empty room. You feel really silly.
quotes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.quote: The nearer emotional life approaches to hysteria, to continual outward show, the less genuine it becomes. Feeling becomes equated with vehemence of expression, so that insincerity becomes permanent.
quotes.author: Anthony Daniels

quotes.quote: Controlled hysteria is what's required. To exist constantly in a state of controlled hysteria. It's agony. But everyone has agony. The difference is that I try to take my agony home and teach it to sing.
quotes.author: Arthur Miller

quotes.quote: Talkatives complain, cry, shout, brag, and are more hysterical about their lives than something else; don’t be a part of that tragedy! Perhaps it's been a while now that you have been complaining, crying and shouting about your 'labour pains'. It's time to show us your baby!
quotes.author: Israelmore Ayivor

quotes.quote: Hysteria is a chaotic and irrational emotional state caused by seeing how the world really operates.
quotes.author: Robert Anton Wilson

quotes.quote: The charges of the hysterics are revealed for what they are: castles in the air built on misrepresentation, supported by unfounded fear, held aloft by hysteria.
quotes.author: John Ashcroft

quotes.quote: We may say that hysteria is a caricature of an artistic creation, a compulsion neurosis a caricature of a religion, and a paranoiac delusion a caricature of a philosophic system.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: As in all moral panics, an accusation is enough to destroy a person's life. Hysteria trumps evidence.
quotes.author: Carol Tavris

quotes.quote: Hysteria is a natural phenomenon, the common denominator of the female nature. It's the big female weapon, and the test of a man is his ability to cope with it.
quotes.author: Tennessee Williams

quotes.quote: Hysteria takes too much energy to be maintained forever.
quotes.author: Mira Grant

quotes.quote: Female hysteria is a subject I'm very fond of. I always try to bring it in somewhere. For me, it is the finest part of the line between comedy and tragedy.
quotes.author: Rachel Cusk

quotes.quote: It was not always unpleasant to deal with a hysterical woman. One feels so thoroughly righteous in comparison.
quotes.author: Adelle Waldman

quotes.quote: There's a hysterical, tired sense of humor that comes after working 14 hours a day, six days a week. I like those things because they take the pressure off the constant stress.
quotes.author: Tom Berenger

quotes.quote: I do not doubt that it would be easier for fate to take away your suffering than it would for me. But you will see for yourself that much has been gained if we succeed in turning your hysterical misery into common unhappiness.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: In every dispute between parent and child, both cannot be right, but they may be, and usually are, both wrong. It is this situation which gives family life its peculiar hysterical charm.
quotes.author: Isaac Rosenfeld

quotes.quote: There's that special magical place that exists when you forget everything else because you are laughing hysterically. It's the only truly safe place and it can happen with a stranger or a best friend.
quotes.author: Natasha Lyonne

quotes.quote: Even rational, data-driven scientists could be sent into prolonged states of hysteria when presented with evidence that their favorite foods might be killing them.
quotes.author: T. Colin Campbell

quotes.quote: Hyteria means the same thing with either laughter or tears.
quotes.author: Tim Sandlin

quotes.quote: When you live in hysteria, people start thinking emotionally.
quotes.author: John Mellencamp

quotes.quote: When the hysteria of a witch-hunt is granted supremacy over the logic, values and spirit of the law, justice can only become a warped, alien concept in that society.
quotes.author: Stewart Stafford

quotes.quote: A period of profound depression can trigger a period of hysterical writing. We create our own afflictions; it is only right that we must cure ourselves.
quotes.author: Kilroy J. Oldster

quotes.quote: Pain is real when you get other people to believe in it. If no one believes in it but you, your pain is madness or hysteria.
quotes.author: Naomi Wolf

quotes.quote: Which made me laugh, of course. If you ever want to get truly hysterical, just get really, really scared, and then have somebody say something funny. You get caught between the laugh and the sob, and it's hard to find your way out.
quotes.author: Kristen D. Randle

quotes.quote: There was one day where I had to be hysterical all day, then of course it's going to affect you. You're going to go home and feel drained, or feel like you need to let off steam.
quotes.author: Gemma Arterton

quotes.quote: Commitment becomes hysterical when those who have nothing to give advocate generosity, and those who have nothing to give up preach renunciation.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: Of all psychic conditions, anxiety verging upon paranoia/hysteria is perhaps the most contagious, even among men.
quotes.author: Joyce Carol Oates
